H0.text: The Moon’s revolution around Earth determines the length of a year.

H1.text: Earth to revolve around the Sun determines the length of a year, which is the amount of time it takes.

H2.text: Earth to rotate on its axis is the amount of time it takes that determines the length of a year.

H3.text: The Sun to rotate on its axis is the amount of time it takes to determine the length of a year.

A4.text: Modern astronomers define the tropical year as time for the Sun's mean longitude to increase by 360°.

A5.text: Variations are found which are due to the perturbations by the Moon and planets acting on the Earth, and to nutation.
